ETYMOLOGY: From Latin momentum ('movement, moving power; moment, importance'), from movere ('to move').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The quantity of motion of a moving body, measured as a product of its mass and velocity.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 运动物体所具有的动量，是其质量和速度的乘积。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The car gained momentum as it rolled down the hill.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 汽车下坡时获得了动量。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The impetus gained by a moving object or developing process; the force or speed of movement.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 推动力；势头；动力，使某事得以继续或发展下去的能量或力量。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The campaign is gaining momentum as the election approaches.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 随着选举临近，这场运动正获得势头。

REGISTER: Common usage, also technical in physics.
